org.middleheaven.util.coersion
Class TypeCoercing

java.lang.Object
  org.middleheaven.util.coersion.TypeCoercing

public class TypeCoercing
extends java.lang.Object

Main utility class for type coercing. When type coercing from a type A to a type B, the value represented by type A is preserved in type B. null is coerced to null.

public static <O,T> T coerce(O value,
                             java.lang.Class<T> type)
Converts a value represented in one type to the same value represented by another type. If type is a primitive type, the conversion

Type Parameters:
O - value original type
T - target conversion type.
Parameters:
value - the value to be converted
type - the target type.
Returns:
The same value represented in the type type.

public static <T,R> R[] coerceArray(T[] array,
                                    java.lang.Class<R> type)
Type Parameters:
T - original type
R - coerced type.
Parameters:
array - the array to coerce.
type - the type to coerce each element.
Returns:
a new array of the new type with each element being the result of coercing the conterpart element in the array.
